rules: Rule1: If aspirin is quality controlled at factory X, then provided that factory X is not compliant with regulations, aspirin is safe for patients.
Rule2: Whenever aspirin is packaged at factory X, aspirin is quality controlled at factory X.
Rule3: Under the condition that factory X is audited internally, if aspirin is manufactured at factory X, then aspirin is packaged at factory X.
Rule4: Provided that factory X is audited externally, if aspirin is manufactured at factory X, then aspirin is packaged at factory X.
Rule5: If factory X is certified for ISO, then factory X is audited internally.
Rule6: Factory X is certified for ISO or factory X is licensed by the FDA.
Rule7: Whenever factory X is licensed by the FDA, factory X is audited externally.
Rule8: If aspirin is filtered through a system, then aspirin is quality controlled at factory X.
Rule9: Either factory X is shutdown in an emergency, or if aspirin is sterilized using equipment, then aspirin is filtered through a system.
Rule10: Provided that factory X is operational under normal conditions, it is not the case that factory X is shutdown in an emergency.
Rule11: Aspirin delivery is expedited or aspirin shipment is not delayed.
Rule12: If aspirin has documented side effects, then provided that factory X is not compliant with regulations, aspirin is not approved by the FDA.
Rule13: Whenever aspirin production is suspended, aspirin is investigated by the FDA.
Rule14: If aspirin is safe for patients, then an aspirin batch is not contaminated.
Rule15: If aspirin is manufactured at factory X, then aspirin is sterilized using equipment.

Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if aspirin is tested in phase three then aspirin has documented side effects then aspirin is recalled from the market, aspirin production is suspended.
Rule17: If factory X is not operational under normal conditions, then aspirin shipment is delayed.
Rule18: If factory X is not compliant with regulations, then aspirin is approved by the FDA.
Rule19: Whenever factory X is not compliant with regulations, an aspirin batch is contaminated.
facts: Fact1: Aspirin is tested in phase three.
Fact2: Aspirin is manufactured at factory X.
Fact3: Aspirin delivery is not expedited.
Fact4: Aspirin is not recalled from the market.
Fact5: Aspirin is not investigated by the FDA.

question: Factory X is compliant with regulations.
